After that article appeared, tech blogger John Gruber gave Eric Schmidt a new title: attendees at a forum organized by the Atlantic Monthly heard him testify to how much Google could learn about its users with their permission: We don't need you to type at all. We know where you are. We know where you've been. We can more or less know what you're thinking about. * In an CNN interview later that month, Eric Schmidt joked that users offended by photos of their homes showing up in Google's Street View mapping feature could`` just move.'' However, talk of the former Nicole Scherzinger 's possible arrival has apparently got Cheryl Cole worried she will be eclipsed by her if they do work together on the series. A source told the Daily Mirror newspaper: Cheryl Cole 's been straight with Simon Cowell but suddenly people aren't returning her calls. She doesn't want to get into a put-up scrap with Nicole Scherzinger with Simon Cowell playing the puppet master. Although he wants Nicole Scherzinger , Simon Cowell still hasn't made a final decision on the line-up and his stalling is said to be concerning TV chiefs who want the judging panel to be signed off.
